As an AI language model, I do not have personal opinions or beliefs, but I can offer a few reasons as to why some people enjoy watching horror movies that employ violence and gore:

1. Thrill-seeking: Some people enjoy the adrenaline rush that comes with watching something intense, violent or disturbing. they find it an overwhelmingly exciting experience to feel fear or extreme unease from a safe viewing distance.

2. Catharsis: Others may enjoy horror movies as a way to release their own negative emotions or stress in a safe space. Studies have shown that horror movies can provide a form of catharsis, allowing viewers to confront their fears and anxieties in a controlled environment.

3. Morbid curiosity: Some people may be drawn to horror movies because they are curious about the darker aspects of the human psyche and what drives people to commit violent acts. The violence and gore in horror movies can be seen as a reflection of human nature and can elicit an academic or intellectual curiosity.

4. Entertainment value: Lastly, some people simply find horror movies entertaining. They enjoy the suspenseful build-up, jump scares, and gruesome effects in movies that are excellently executed, innovative and original.

Of course, everyone has their preferences regarding what they find entertaining or not, but the above reasons provide some insight into why many may find watching gore and violence in horror movies a thrilling experience.
